repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: Problem: Nvim version is always compared to latest upstream HEAD. Solution: If current Nvim is not a nightly build, check upstream stable version.

comment_data.body: I do not think we need to bother with trying both git and curl. Just pick one. `git` is a reasonable expectation for this feature, let's drop the `curl` branches.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -532,6 +532,82 @@ local function detect_terminal()
   return 'unknown'
 end
 
+---@param nvim_version string
+local function check_stable_version(nvim_version)
+  local latest_version = nil
+  if vim.fn.executable('git') == 1 then
+    local result = vim
+      .system({
+        'git',
+        'ls-remote',
+        '--tags',
+        'https://github.com/neovim/neovim',
+      }, { text = true })
+      :wait()
+    local stable_sha = result.stdout:match('(%x+)%s+refs/tags/stable\n')
+    if stable_sha then
+      latest_version = result.stdout:match(stable_sha .. '%s+refs/tags/v?(%d+%.%d+%.%d+)%^{}')
+    end
+  else
+    if vim.fn.executable('curl') == 1 then

+        string.format('Neovim %s is available (current: %s)', latest_version, current_version)

+end

comment_data.body: For nightly builds, perhaps some users download the daily pre-built versions using curl? If it's not necessary, then let's remove it.

comment_data.body:
does this need to report `Cannot check for updates` (like `check_head_hash` already does)?

please always check failure cases, that is always expected.

   return 'unknown'
 end
 
+---@param nvim_version string

comment_data.body: this should be done in `check_sysinfo`, before calling either one.

comment_data.body: Right,  currently we have too many Git checks in many of the health modules. In fact, we have already performed these checks in `check_external_tools`. Ideally, if the modules could interoperate in terms of dependencies, things could be simpler. What I mean is that some other modules could also optimize their Git checks, for example vim.pack.

comment_data.body:
i suppose the `check_external_tools` is good enough, but then we should update this message:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6cfb0a66a2cb10c1656b3ee454c81b39d2c219f2/runtime/lua/vim/health/health.lua#L435

    health.warn('git not found (required for `vim.pack`, and Nvim update check)')

comment_data.body:
> if a dependency in `check_external_tools` fails, some health checks shouldn't need to run, right?

that would require a bit more thought (and don't want to spend time on it). silently hiding healthchecks is not really a good UX. then users will never know what checks are missing, or they will wonder why a check is not shown.

comment_data.body:
can remove a level of nesting
```suggestion
  elseif vim.trim(commit) ~= '' then
    ...
  else
    ...
  end
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -540,33 +589,13 @@ local function check_sysinfo()
   local nvim_version = version_out:match('NVIM (v[^\n]+)') or 'unknown'
   local commit --[[@type string]] = (version_out:match('%+g(%x+)') or ''):sub(1, 12)
 
-  if vim.trim(commit) ~= '' then
-    local has_git = vim.fn.executable('git') == 1
-    local has_curl = vim.fn.executable('curl') == 1
-    local cmd = has_git and { 'git', 'ls-remote', 'https://github.com/neovim/neovim', 'HEAD' }
-      or has_curl and {
-        'curl',
-        '-s',
-        'https://api.github.com/repos/neovim/neovim/commits/master',
-        '-H',
-        'Accept: application/vnd.github.sha',
-      }
-      or nil
-
-    if cmd then
-      local result = vim.system(cmd, { text = true }):wait()
-      if result.code == 0 then
-        local upstream = assert(result.stdout:match('^(%x+)') or result.stdout)
-        if not upstream:find(commit) then
-          vim.health.warn(
-            ('Build is outdated. Local: %s, Latest: %s'):format(commit, upstream:sub(1, 12))
-          )
-        else
-          vim.health.ok(('Using latest HEAD: %s'):format(upstream:sub(1, 12)))
-        end
-      end
+  if vim.fn.executable('git') ~= 1 then
+    vim.health.warn('Cannot check for updates: git not found')
+  else
+    if vim.trim(commit) ~= '' then

@@ -532,6 +532,61 @@ local function detect_terminal()
   return 'unknown'
 end
 
+---@param nvim_version string
+local function check_stable_version(nvim_version)

comment_data.body: `BufDelete` raised for both bdelete and bwipeout, so why narrow this to `BufWipeout` ?  user or a plugin may delete the buffer without using bwipeout. although `bufhidden` might take precedence, not sure... but it's better to be more generic here.

comment_regular_data.body: Refactored it. Now it uses `vim.version` for proper semantic version comparison, and `vim.startswith` instead of  string sub for comparing hashes.  added a timeout to the git check. additionally, I switched from `BufDelete` to `BufWipeout`, since the health buffer uses bufhidden=wipeout.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(health): support checking stable release version
